intro: Clidemia clementiana, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves with a glossy surface and produces small, white to pale pink flowers in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal and lowland forests. Clidemia clementiana plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of Hawaiian ecosystems.
